sentences.sContent: Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.
sentences.sContent_eng: Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.
sentences.sCn: 弟兄们，先祖大卫的事，我可以明明的对你们说，他死了，也葬埋了，并且他的坟墓，直到今日还在我们这里。

synos.tran: 坟墓；圣体安置所（等于Easter sepulchre）

words.tran: 阴森森的；坟墓的，丧葬的

trans.tranCn: 坟墓；圣体安置所（等于Easter sepulchre）
trans.tranOther: A sepulchre is a building or room in which a dead person is buried
